content.description: Climb nice holds at the far left side of the West Face, to a ledge. Continue up from the right side of the ledge. Can also be used for descent.
content.location: West Face, just right of NW corner of The Cube.

content.description: Highball topout on bigger holds but techy crux mid height
content.location: Left most route on the East face.   Descent: Down climb the V2 perfect poser on the north face, also has bolts Up top for rappelling.

content.description:
Start standing 15 feet right of the jug rail on total devastation on a right hand crimp at about 8 feet and a very small left hand crimp at about 6 feet. Climb left through tensiony moves on small crimps to the jug rail on total devastation. See beta video below:

youtu.be/i_UQzpxBZxA
content.location: Start standing 15 feet right of the jug rail on total devastation on a right hand crimp at about 8 feet and a very small left hand crimp at about 6 feet. Climb left through tensiony moves on small crimps to the jug rail on total devastation.

content.description:
Tall and good. Lots of sloping edges lead to larger sloping edges for 30 feet of great stone. This has a low crux, so this climb actually serves well as a down climb from the boulder.  

  Can be started on the left and traverse up and right to the ledges, or start on the right, and traverse up left into the ledge system.
content.protection: 2-3 pads for the bottom, don't fall from mid way up.
content.location: On the Cube, around the corner to the left of Fear of a Black Hat. Look for a series of ledges leading to the summit.

content.description: The direct variation to total devastation. Shares the same crux move. Instead of bailing out left climb up to a hollow flake and up to a difficult top out where the climb gets it's name. Very balance intensive climb past the crux of total devastation. Basically once you get to the Crux move of total devastation climb up and right to a flake and up to the top!
content.protection: 3 pads, but you don't want to fall off past the crux pocket move or the mantle!
content.location: Same start as total devastation next to the Arete.

content.description: Crouch start with a hueco, follow the overhanging arete just left of "A Clockwork Orange". Highball.
Stand start; climb the face right of Perfect Poser with smaller edges. Take a deep breath half way and make a big reach to the middle of the boulder and climb straight up.
content.protection: Anchor located at the top for a toprope. Lots of pads.

content.description: Same start as "Fear of a Black Hat". Follow an obvious line of pockets and crimpers up overhanging patina. Highball.
Large cube shaped boulder straight north on the trail that starts at the cul-de-sac. One of, if not the, tallest boulders in calico.
